org.easybatch.core.api

Interface RecordReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApacheCommonCsvRecordReader, CliRecordReader, FileRecordReader, FlatFileRecordReader, JdbcRecordReader, JmsRecordReader, JpaRecordReader, JsonRecordReader, ListRecordReader, MongoDBRecordReader, QueueRecordReader, StringRecordReader, XmlRecordReader

    public interface RecordReader
    Interface for record reader. This will be used by easy batch to sequentially read records from a data source.
    Author:
    Mahmoud Ben Hassine (mahmoud@benhassine.fr)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the reader.
      java.lang.String getDataSourceName()
      This method returns a human readable data source name to be shown in the batch report.
      java.lang.Long getTotalRecords()
      Get the total record number in the data source.
      boolean hasNextRecord()
      Check if the reader has a next record.
      void open()
      Open the reader.
      Record readNextRecord()
      Read next record from the data source.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
           throws RecordReaderClosingException
        Close the reader.
        Throws:
        RecordReaderClosingException - thrown if an exception occurs during reader closing

      • getDataSourceName

        java.lang.String getDataSourceName()
        This method returns a human readable data source name to be shown in the batch report.
        Returns:
        the data source name this reader is reading data from

      • getTotalRecords

        java.lang.Long getTotalRecords()
        Get the total record number in the data source. This is useful to calculate execution progress.
        Returns:
        the total record number in the data source or null if the total records number cannot be calculated in advance

      • hasNextRecord

        boolean hasNextRecord()
        Check if the reader has a next record.
        Returns:
        true if the reader has a next record, false else.

      • open

        void open()
          throws RecordReaderOpeningException
        Open the reader.
        Throws:
        RecordReaderOpeningException - thrown if an exception occurs during reader opening

      • readNextRecord

        Record readNextRecord()
                      throws RecordReadingException
        Read next record from the data source.
        Returns:
        the next record from the data source.
        Throws:
        RecordReadingException - thrown if an exception occurs during reading next record
